explicit

Class PredecessorRelation

  • java.lang.Object
    • explicit.PredecessorRelation

  • public class PredecessorRelation
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for storing and accessing the predecessor relation of an explicit Model.

    As Model only provide easy access to successors of states, the predecessor relation is computed and stored for subsequent efficient access.

    Note: Naturally, if the model changes, the predecessor relation has to be recomputed to remain accurate.

      • calculatePreStar

        public java.util.BitSet calculatePreStar(java.util.BitSet remain,
                                         java.util.BitSet target,
                                         java.util.BitSet absorbing)
        Computes the set Pre*(target) via a DFS, i.e., all states that are in target or can reach target via one or more transitions from states contained in remain.
        If the parameter remain is null, then remain is considered to include all states in the model.
        If the parameter absorbing is not null, then the states in absorbing are considered to be absorbing, i.e., to have a single self-loop, disregarding other outgoing edges.
        Parameters:
        remain - restriction on the states that may occur on the path to target, null = all states
        target - The set of target states
        absorbing - (optional) set of states that should be considered to be absorbing, i.e., their outgoing edges are ignored, null = no states
        Returns:
        the set of states Pre*(target)
